property.value: Afghan children playing soccer in Jalalabad

note.text: The national sport of Afghanistan is called “buzkashi,” which literally means “goat bashing.” Players mounted on horses compete to drag a goat carcass toward a goal. Buzkashi was originally developed by Genghis Khan to prepare soldiers for battle.

Afghanistan is also famous for its competitive kite-flying, which was banned under the Taliban along with buzkashi. The goal of kite battles is to sever your opponent's kite string, bringing the kite to the ground.
